elements.title: Palmire Dumont (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Palmire Dumont, a pioneer of LGBT nightlife in "Gay Paree", was among the first members of the French Bulldog-Owners Club (her dog pictured) and met other bulldog owners in her lesbian bar?

elements.title: Bokura no Kazoku (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2005 video game Bokura no Kazoku was inspired in part by the birth of its creator's first child?

elements.title: Keith Raniere (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Keith Raniere co-founded NXIVM, a multi-level marketing company that has been described as a cult?

elements.title: 2023 Tour Féminin des Pyrénées (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the final stage of the 2023 Tour Féminin des Pyrénées was cancelled for safety reasons?

elements.title: Henry de Hinuber (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the actions of Henry de Hinuber and his battalions during the Battle of Bayonne in 1814 reportedly "saved the allies from a very terrible disaster"?

elements.title: Two Sketches for a Sonata (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Igor Stravinsky's unfinished Two Sketches for a Sonata has been called a "poignant summing-up of a life's work"?

elements.title: Marie Sophie Hingst (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when the German-Irish historian Marie Sophie Hingst was revealed to be faking descent from Holocaust survivors, the media of different countries disagreed on how to report on it?

elements.title: Peter III (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Peter III, a cat employed by the British government, was buried in Ilford with "full honours"?
